headline: Bubbles and Boring Bets: What’s Coming for Tech Stocks in 2026
summary: While tech giants like Alphabet Inc. and Nvidia Corp. delivered strong gains, unsung corners of the industry, like memory chips and hard disk drives, proved to be far better places for investors.  With the bull market in US stocks stretching into a fourth year, there are more concerns than ever about the sustainability of heavy spending on AI computing and whether the returns will justify the investments.

content.title: Bubbles and Boring Bets: What’s Coming for Tech Stocks in 2026
content.summary: While tech giants like Alphabet Inc. and Nvidia Corp. delivered strong gains, unsung corners of the industry, like memory chips and hard disk drives, proved to be far better places for investors.  With the bull market in US stocks stretching into a fourth year, there are more concerns than ever about the sustainability of heavy spending on AI computing and whether the returns will justify the investments.

headline: Oracle Stock Jumps On Reports TikTok Signed Deal To Create U.S. Joint Venture
summary: TikTok reportedly has signed a much-anticipated deal to spin off its U.S. operations to an investor group that includes software giant Oracle.  The deal is designed to satisfy the requirements of a 2024 law banning the short-video app unless TikTok's Chinese parent company, ByteDance, divests ownership.  The new TikTok U.S. joint venture will be 50% held by a consortium of investors that includes Oracle, private-equity firm Silver Lake and Abu Dhabi-based investment fund MGX, according to a company memo reported by the Wall Street Journal.

content.title: Oracle Stock Jumps On Reports TikTok Signed Deal To Create U.S. Joint Venture
content.summary: TikTok reportedly has signed a much-anticipated deal to spin off its U.S. operations to an investor group that includes software giant Oracle.  The deal is designed to satisfy the requirements of a 2024 law banning the short-video app unless TikTok's Chinese parent company, ByteDance, divests ownership.  The new TikTok U.S. joint venture will be 50% held by a consortium of investors that includes Oracle, private-equity firm Silver Lake and Abu Dhabi-based investment fund MGX, according to a company memo reported by the Wall Street Journal.

headline: TikTok Signs Agreement for U.S. Venture. Oracle Stock Jumps.
summary: TikTok and Chinese owner ByteDance signed agreements with Oracle and two other investors to form a new U.S. joint venture.  CEO Shou Zi Chew told employees in a memo viewed by Barron’s that the joint venture will be 50% held by a consortium of new investors, which includes Oracle, Silver Lake, and MGX.  Each of those firms will hold 15% in the new entity, named TikTok USDS Joint Venture LLC.

content.summary: TikTok and Chinese owner ByteDance signed agreements with Oracle and two other investors to form a new U.S. joint venture.  CEO Shou Zi Chew told employees in a memo viewed by Barron’s that the joint venture will be 50% held by a consortium of new investors, which includes Oracle, Silver Lake, and MGX.  Each of those firms will hold 15% in the new entity, named TikTok USDS Joint Venture LLC.

headline: Tiktok agrees to sell US operations to American-led investor group
summary:
STORY: Social media giant TikTok is selling just over 80% of its U.S. assets, in a move to avoid a ban in the country. 

Chinese owner ByteDance said Thursday that it had signed binding agreements with three major investors:  Oracle, Silver Lake, and Abu Dhabi-based MGX.

The deal will create a new U.S. company called TikTok USDS Joint Venture. 

ByteDance will retain a stake of just under 20%. 

The move is a big step to end years of worry about TikTok's future in the U.S.

It had faced a ban from January this year under a law requiring it to divest its assets in the country over national security concerns. 

:: File

Donald Trump also tried to ban the app during his first term, but later became a fan, crediting it with helping him win last year's election. 

He opted to delay the January ban upon taking office this year. 

The deal's details align with a plan unveiled in September. 

In a memo to employees, TikTok said it would enable quote "over 170 million Americans to continue discovering a world of endless possibilities as part of a vital global community."

content.title: Tiktok agrees to sell US operations to American-led investor group

The deal will create a new U.S. company called TikTok USDS Joint Venture. 

ByteDance will retain a stake of just under 20%. 

The move is a big step to end years of worry about TikTok's future in the U.S.

It had faced a ban from January this year under a law requiring it to divest its assets in the country over national security concerns. 

:: File

Donald Trump also tried to ban the app during his first term, but later became a fan, crediting it with helping him win last year's election.

headline: Does Oracle or Microsoft have more to lose if OpenAI underperforms?
summary: The wait for Yahoo Finance's 2025 Company of the Year is over, and the winner is private artificial intelligence giant and ChatGPT parent company OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). D.A. Davidson's head of technology research, Gil Luria, told Yahoo Finance last week that stakeholder Microsoft (MSFT) will be the biggest gainer from OpenAI's success, while Oracle (ORCL) may have the most to lose if OpenAI's artificial intelligence visions don't pan out. Epistrophy Capital Research Chief Market Strategist Cory Johnson explains Oracle's business strategy while managing its debt. Johnson is also the host of The Drill Down Podcast. Be sure to watch Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi's full interview with OpenAI CFO Sarah Friar. Also catch Cory Johnson explain why the market may have been over-reliant on whether OpenAI performed in 2025 or not. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Does Oracle or Microsoft have more to lose if OpenAI underperforms?
content.description:
The wait for Yahoo Finance's 2025 Company of the Year is over, and the winner is private artificial intelligence giant and ChatGPT parent company OpenAI (OPAI.PVT).

D.A. Davidson's head of technology research, Gil Luria, told Yahoo Finance last week that stakeholder Microsoft (MSFT) will be the biggest gainer from OpenAI's success, while Oracle (ORCL) may have the most to lose if OpenAI's artificial intelligence visions don't pan out.

Epistrophy Capital Research Chief Market Strategist Cory Johnson explains Oracle's business strategy while managing its debt. Johnson is also the host of The Drill Down Podcast.

Be sure to watch Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi's full interview with OpenAI CFO Sarah Friar.

Also catch Cory Johnson explain why the market may have been over-reliant on whether OpenAI performed in 2025 or not.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Oracle and OpenAI Win Michigan Approval to Power New Data Center
summary: DTE had asked regulators for expedited approval of its plan to power the multi-billion dollar, 1.4-gigawatt facility in Saline Township.  Each of the regulators said Thursday the proposed contracts between the utility and tech firms protected the power grid and regular people.  “They show a net financial benefit to DTE’s other customers,” said Dan Scripps, chair of the Michigan Public Service Commission.

headline: Oracle Stock Jumps After Forming TikTok Joint Venture
summary: TikTok and Chinese owner ByteDance signed agreements with Oracle and two other investors to form a new U.S. joint venture.  CEO Shou Zi Chew told employees in a memo viewed by Barron’s that the joint venture will be 50% held by a consortium of new investors, which includes Oracle, Silver Lake, and MGX.  Each of those firms will hold 15% in the new entity, named TikTok USDS Joint Venture LLC.

CEO Shou Zi Chew told employees in a memo viewed by Barron’s that the joint venture will be 50% held by a consortium of new investors, which includes Oracle, Silver Lake, and MGX.  Each of those firms will hold 15% in the new entity, named TikTok USDS Joint Venture LLC.

headline: Starbucks taps Amazon's Anand Varadarajan as new chief technology officer
summary: Starbucks said on ​Friday it has appointed Anand ‌Varadarajan as its new chief technology officer, ‌effective January 19, as CEO Brian Niccol pushes a tech revamp in stores to make labor more ⁠efficient. Varadarajan will ‌fill the role after Deb Hall Lefevre stepped down in ‍September, following which the coffee chain named Ningyu Chen as interim CTO. Varadarajan comes ​after a 19-year stint at ‌Amazon, where he headed the technology and supply chain operations for its worldwide grocery business.

Varadarajan comes ​after a 19-year stint at ‌Amazon, where he headed the technology and supply chain operations for its worldwide grocery business.

headline: TikTok's future uncertain after US joint venture deal, says analyst
summary:
STORY: The deal to hand control of TikTok’s U.S. operations to a group of investors, including Oracle, marked a major turning point after years of uncertainty over the future of the popular video app.

But former Peking University business professor Jeffrey Towson says it raises new questions about the new entity’s ability to compete.

"It's not obvious what happens with this company going forward because you just went from a global platform to a regional one, but your competitors are still global. Their primary competitors are YouTube and Facebook, Instagram reels. Well, if they're separate, then they are dramatically smaller than the global giants, which was not the case last month. So that has some interesting, sort of, business strategy and competition questions that get raised."

The deal is aimed at avoiding a U.S. ban of the short video app, which is used regularly by more than 170 million Americans.

It comes after a yearslong saga to force TikTok's Chinese owner ByteDance to sell its U.S. operation, which began in August 2020, when President Donald Trump first tried unsuccessfully to ban the app over U.S. national security concerns.

Financial terms of the deal, announced in an internal memo by TikTok (U.S.) seen by Reuters, were not disclosed.

The White House said in September the new joint venture would operate TikTok's U.S. app, but questions remain about the deal, including the business relationships between the new joint venture and ByteDance… which will still own about 20% of the U.S. company.

Sources told Reuters in September that ByteDance would also own a separate division that would control the revenue-generating business operations such as e-commerce and advertising.

Those arrangements formed the deal framework announced on Thursday, two sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Friday.

"The big question is still, is Chinese government going to approve this? Because they've never actually said that they would. The Trump administration has said its been approved by them, but we've never actually heard anything from the Chinese government formally. Now, who knows what's going on behind closed doors? In theory, that could happen quite quickly or it could emerge as a problem. I suspect it's probably not a problem, but we don't actually know the other major party at the table in terms of the decision making here."

Oracle will own the majority of the joint venture along with private equity group Silver Lake and Abu Dhabi-based MGX.

Shares of Oracle rose as much as 8% in Friday morning trading.

Their primary competitors are YouTube and Facebook, Instagram reels. Well, if they're separate, then they are dramatically smaller than the global giants, which was not the case last month. So that has some interesting, sort of, business strategy and competition questions that get raised."
